result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald B Rucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court sentenced defendant to pay a fine of $50.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges at the rate of $50.00 oer month commencing April 1, 2015. Failure to pay fine will result in a civil judgment or tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald B Rucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is consistant with appointment and testing negative. Defendant has completed community service.   The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41 (3g), a class U Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court orders defendant to $50.00 FINE plus pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, at a rate of $50.00 monthly commencing April 1, 2015, on the first of each month until paid in full or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is testing negative, completed community service and actively engaged in treatment.  Review hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of 6 months.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned for a Review Hearing on 10-20-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 6.  Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Effective August 3, 2014, this case will be assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use any illegal drugs.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Reginald B Rucker in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Daniel J Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary Hearing is scheduled for 5-27-2014, at 1:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5-15-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
